bibl.title: Letter from Wade Hampton Frost to Laura Armistead Carter, October 20, 1928

div1.p: Frost sends Laura Carter the write-up on Henry Carter done for the National Cyclopedia of American Biography.

div1.head: Letter from Wade Hampton Frost to Laura Armistead Carter, October 20, 1928
div1.opener:
THE JOHNS HOPKINS UNIVERSITY
SCHOOL OF HYGIENE AND PUBLIC HEALTH
615 NORTH WOLFE STREET
BALTIMORE, MD.
October 20, 1928.
DEPARTMENT OF EPIDEMIOLOGY
Miss Laura A. Carter,
2122 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
My dear Miss Laura:
div1.p:
I am enclosing for you the sketch prepared for
the National Cyclopedia of American Biography. I had
forgotten that I had it and apologise accordingly.

I think that with a few alterations of passages
which are already marked, everything which is actually
objectionable or misleading may easily be corrected.
I doubt that any more may be done, for the article is evi-
dently written in a standard style by whoever does the
hack writing for the publication. So long as it has
no actual misstatements the rest I think is unimportant.
I know nothing of the publication but feel sure it is not
one of importance, so that nothing would be lost by omit-
ting publication in it. On the other hand, I think there
is no objection at all to inclusion of this sketch.

I will ask Mrs. Smiley to make the copies that you
want, but in the meantime, you need feel no uneasiness about
loss of your own copy, for I have in my safe at least two
copies of each memorandum.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, W. H. Frost. whf/f
encl.
